data.sampled:
Yes, we can express the statement "More men have finished high school than she has" in a formal logical system using the following logical predicate:

∃x (M(x) ∧ (x > S(y)))

Where:
- M(x) represents the statement "x is a man"
- S(y) represents the statement "y has finished high school"
- x is a variable representing an individual
- y is the individual we are comparing to men who have finished high school

By using this logical predicate, we can determine if there exists at least one man who has finished high school more than y.

data.sampled:
To translate the statement "More kids have finished school than you have" into a formal logical system, you could represent it as an implication: 

P: "At least one kid has finished school."
Q: "You have finished school."

Then, the statement can be represented as P → ¬Q, which translates to "If at least one kid has finished school, then you have not finished school."
